text: Variables are used to store information that your program can use and modify. Think of them as labeled boxes that hold values.

text: Try dragging the variable blocks into the designated area to see their values in action. This helps visualize how variables store and update information.

items: Variable names should be descriptive (e.g., score, userName).
They cannot start with a number.
Variable names are case-sensitive (x and X are different).
You can change the value stored in a variable anytime.

text: Variables make programs dynamic. You can store user input, calculate values, and use them later anywhere in your code.
